triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes reinforcement learning as the primary mechanism through which agents can develop general intelligence.

triples.name: Artificial general intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that reward maximization could constitute a solution to artificial general intelligence.

triples.name: Intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper uses intelligence as a fundamental concept to explore how it relates to reward maximization.

triples.name: Trial and error
triples.relevance: The paper describes how agents learn through trial and error experience to maximize reward.

triples.name: Machine perception
triples.relevance: The paper identifies perception as one of the key abilities that could be driven by reward maximization.

triples.name: Generalization (learning)
triples.relevance: The paper discusses generalization as one of the abilities that reward-driven agents could develop.

triples.name: Imitation learning
triples.relevance: The paper identifies imitation as one of the key abilities that could emerge from reward-maximizing behavior.

triples.name: Social intelligence
triples.relevance: The paper identifies social intelligence as one of the abilities that could be driven by reward maximization.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The paper discusses language as one of the abilities that reward-maximizing agents could exhibit.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes that machine learning through reward maximization is sufficient to drive general intelligence.
